entrance.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a place
entrance.translation[0].definitions[0].e: the main entrance to the school
entrance.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the act of entering a place or room, especially in a way that people notice
entrance.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Bridget made a dramatic entrance into the room.
entrance.translation[0].definitions[2].d: the right or ability to go into a place
entrance.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Reporters even managed to gain entrance to her hotel.
How much is the entrance fee  (=money you pay to get in somewhere)?
Entrance to the museum is free.
entrance.translation[0].definitions[3].d: permission to become a member of or become involved in a profession, university, society etc
entrance.translation[0].definitions[3].e: the initial interview for entrance to the Civil Service
entrance.translation[0].definitions[4].d: when a person, country, organization etc first becomes involved in a particular area of activity
entrance.translation[0].definitions[4].e: The referendum blocked Switzerlandâ€™s entrance into the European Economic Area.
entrance.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: She found a parking space close to the hospital's main entrance.
There is a long drive with steps leading to the front entrance.
I could see part of the yard through the narrow entrance.
There was a wide entrance at the front of the building.
Our taxi pulled up outside the hotel entrance.
We watched as the ferry approached the harbour entrance.
At high tide, the tunnel entrance is totally submerged.
People passed in single file through the narrow entrance.
It's quicker to use the side entrance.
A large stone blocked the entrance to the tomb.
He walked through the front door into the entrance hall.
There was no sign of her in the entrance foyer.
Soldiers were guarding the entrance gate.
entrance.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if you are entranced by someone or something, you give them all your attention because they are so beautiful, interesting etc
entrance.translation[1].definitions[0].e: I was entranced by the sweetness of her voice.
